item.title: 'Many of us get thrush, so why the hush?' YouTube comedy trio who shot to fame for their lip-sync car videos try to break the stigma around the 'embarrassing' condition
item.description: Australian comedy group SketchSHE have taken to the skies on a jaunt through a condition many women are too embarrassed to talk about - thrush.
item.content:encoded:
They are the glamorous trio who rose to fame after filming themselves miming along to tunes in their car.

And now Australian comedy group SketchSHE have taken to the skies on a jaunt through a condition many women are too embarrassed to talk about - thrush.

YouTube stars Shae-Lee Shackleford, Lana Kington and Madison Lloyd opted for a high altitude singalong in a bid to break the stigma surrounding the infection.

In the music video clip, the women, dressed as SketchSHE Airlines flight attendants, reassure a self-conscious passenger who needs to take her thrush medication.

Scroll down for video

Australian comedy group SketchSHE (pictured) have taken to the skies on a jaunt through a condition many women are too embarrassed to talk about - thrush

Symptoms of thrush 

The comedy group - who was featured on  Ellen DeGeneres for their 'Mime Through Time' video - are famously known for their entertaining clips, where they sit in a car and mime along to top hits as different characters.

Now, SketchSHE has teamed up with Bayer's thrush treatment Canesten to launch Thrush: The Musical to encourage women to feel comfortable about the condition.

The lyrics goes: 'Many of us get thrush, so why the hush? 

'We want you feelin' fine on SketchShe Airlines. 

'No reason for it to be taboo. Yeah, it's just a case of thrush in your coochie coo.'

Up to 75 per cent of Australian women experience thrush at least once in their lives - but are too afraid to admit or talk about the condition. 

In the video , the SketchSHE Airlines flight attendants reassure a self-conscious passenger (pictured) who needs to take her thrush medication

The trio opted for a high altitude singalong in a bid to break the stigma surrounding thrush

The trio released Thrush: The Musical to inspire women to feel comfortable about the infection

Creating the bespoke music video after partnering with media agency PHD, the campaign used comedy as a means to overcome the barrier. 

Many of us get thrush, so why the hush? We want you feelin' fine on SketchShe Airlines. No reason for it to be taboo. Yeah, it's just a case of thrush in your coochie coo

The video aims to inspire women to hopefully feel less alone in the condition and feel comfortable seeking treatment.

'We were finally able to bring our Britney-Spears-esque dream of performing on an aeroplane to life,' SketchSHE said.

'Buckle up as we take you for a song and dance about what many of us experience in our lady garden.'

Brand manager for Canesten Stephanie Weschke said they hope the playful video opens up a conversation about thrush.

Brand manager for Canesten Stephanie Weschke said they hope the playful video opens up a conversation about thrush

The comedy group are dressed as SketchSHE Airlines flight attendants in the latest music clip

YouTube stars Shae-Lee Shackleford, Lana Kington and Madison Lloyd famously known for their entertaining clips, where they sit in a car and mime along to top tunes

Causes of thrush

'We want women to feel empowered and confident about their intimate health and wellbeing,' she said.

'That's why we are very excited to partner with SketchSHE to help raise awareness about thrush, a condition that is very common among women. 

'While it can be embarrassing to talk about, the collaboration on Thrush: The Musical with SketchSHE is an exciting avenue for us to help women who may suffer from it feel less alone.'

Director of Content at PHD Content Angela Rapley said talking about women's intimate health should not be a difficult task.

'We hope that this campaign will make women smile and feel just a little less awkward about getting treatment,' she said.

'Some of the euphemisms in the song are not for the faint-hearted, but at the end of the day it's a bit of fun about a subject that's normally never talked about.'
item.dc:abstract: They are the glamorous trio who rose to fame after filming themselves miming along to tunes in their car. And now Australian comedy group SketchSHE have taken to the skies on a jaunt through a condition many women are too embarrassed to talk about - thrush. YouTube stars Shae-Lee Shackleford, Lana Kington and Madison Lloyd opted for a high altitude singalong in a bid to break the stigma surrounding the infection.

item.title: What a difference (six) years makes! Twitter users share astonishing then and now snaps from 2012 and today... and it's hard to believe they're the same people
item.description: The jaw-dropping comparisons, compiled by Bored Panda, capture people before and after an awkward teenage phase, with one ruefully captioning their snaps 'thank you puberty'.
item.content:encoded:
Hans Christian Anderson once told the tale of 'The Ugly Duckling', who was teased for his awkward looks before maturing into a majestic swan.

And it's been a case of life imitating art for many of the young people sharing their transformation snaps on Twitter using the #2012vs2018 hashtag.

In many cases the jaw-dropping then and now comparisons, compiled by Bored Panda, capture people before and after an awkward teenage phase, with one ruefully captioning their own transformation snaps 'thank you puberty'.    

'I forgot how bad I looked back then', another person joked, while a third admitted of their throwback snap from 2012: 'I had much worse pictures but I deleted the evidence from Facebook'.

Scroll down for some of the most astonishing before and after comparisons...  

Young people who took to Twitter and Bored Panda over the weekend, to share their transformation pictures for the viral #2012vs2018 hashtag

 The honest side-by-side comparison snaps proved just how much they had changed over six years

One snap showed how a woman had mastered the art of make-up and learned her angles for selfies

Many revealed they were teased as teenagers, and wrote 'thank you puberty' alongside pictures of their incredible transformations

'2012 was a rough year': One young man showed off just how much he had changed, joking about his former appearance 

'I forgot how bad I looked back then', one person joked about their picture as they shared the before and after snaps

'I had much worse pictures but I deleted the evidence from Facebook', one user wrote alongside their pictures

One woman shared a sweet beaming snap of herself in 2012 alongside a smoldering selfie of herself in 2018

Another user proved that a simple brow tidy up and a good mascara could inject a bit of fast glamour

One woman showed how she had given herself a hair and fashion make-over as she sizzled for the camera

One man proudly showed off his weight loss with the simple caption 'wow'
item.dc:abstract: Social media users around the world have been revealing how much they've changed over the years by sharing a snap from 2012 and one from today. Many of the pictures shared using the #2012vs2018 hashtag capture people before and after their awkward teenage phase, with one contributor ruefully captioning their snap: 'Thank you, puberty'.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott
item.mi:shortTitle: #2012vs2018 transformations show how much people can change in 6 years

item.title: Keep your black clothes but get rid of the Crocs! Men and women reveal the best outfits to wear on your first date - and the looks to avoid
item.description: Our clothes can often say a lot about us. A new survey has revealed what is acceptable to wear on a first date and what is not.
item.content:encoded:
We tend to make up our mind about someone within seconds of meeting them, and a large part of that is due to their appearance and dress sense.

This doesn't change when it comes to dating and your clothes can often say something about you before you've even opened your mouth. 

To understand how fashion influences the way we date, Zoosk surveyed 6,646 of its members and analysed 34,579 profiles.

The international site wanted to understand how daters dress, what people consider proper attire, and what fashion trends singles like best.

To understand how fashion influences the way we date, Zoosk surveyed 6,646 of its members and analysed 34,579 profiles

Unfortunately for those less fashionable, having a good taste in fashion is important for many people on the dating scene.

More than half of women say it's a deal-breaker if a date is dressed poorly or has bad style, while the majority of men (73 per cent) believe the opposite.

The younger generation care the least about fashion out of everyone, with 77 per cent of both male and female millennials said they can look past someone with bad style.

This being said, 69 per cent of singles say that the best way to make a good first impression is to look nice and presentable.

Wearing socks with sandals or Crocs were big no-nos, so avoid wearing them if you're trying to make a good impression

When it comes to the first date, 94 per cent of women said that dressing nicely is essential, and 86 per cent of singles say it's important to dress nice when it comes to getting ready for a date.

FASHION FAUX PAS FOR SINGLES

- Wrinkled clothes - 66%

- Socks and sandals - 55%

- Crocs - 53%

- Baggy clothes - 50%

- Board shorts/swimwear - 45%

- Dressing too young for your age - 44%

- Pants that are too short/long - 39%

- Low-rise/slung pants - 38%

- Super tight shirts - 34% 

Again, millennials are a bit more laid back in this regard as only 76 per cent think dressing nice on a date is important.

There are also certain fashion decisions that should be avoided, according to the survey from Zoosk. 

Two-thirds of singles say wrinkled clothes are the biggest turn-off, and baggy clothes weren't popular either.

Wearing socks with sandals or Crocs were other big no-nos as well, so if you're trying to make a good impression it would be best to avoid wearing them.

There are also certain outfits that make men and women feel the most confident when seeing a potential new beau. 

22 per cent of men surveyed said that they liked the bold red lip on women

OUTFITS THAT MAKE WOMEN FEEL SEXY 

- All black everything 40%

- Jeans and a T-shirt 39%

- High heels 38%

- Sexy underwear 32%

- A sundress 31%

OUTFITS THAT MAKE MEN FEEL SEXY

- A button-down shirt - 60%

- A blazer/jacket - 36%

- Jeans and a T-shirt - 33%

- All black everything -16%

- Sportswear or athleisure - 15% 


More than a third of those surveyed said the simple combo of jeans and a T-shirt was the best option for confidence levels.

Wearing all black everything was also a popular choice for women, and men agreed that a button-down shirt is the way to go.

When it comes to make up, not many people can look past the classic red lip, with 22 per cent of men saying they liked the bold look. 

However, 90 per cent of all daters, say light and natural make up is their favourite choice.
item.dc:abstract: We tend to make up our mind about someone within seconds of meeting them, and a large part of that is due to their appearance and dress sense. This doesn't change when it comes to dating and your clothes can often say something about you before you've even opened your mouth. To understand how fashion influences the way we date, Zoosk surveyed 6,646 of its members and analysed 34,579 profiles. The international site wanted to understand how daters dress, what people consider proper date attire, and what fashion trends singles like best.
item.dc:creator: Sheree Mutton
item.mi:shortTitle: Research reveals the fashion faux pas we should avoid when dating

item.title: Cafe sells $6 RAINBOW coffee and has loyal customers 'buying it every single day' - but does it taste as good as a traditional brew?
item.description: Piggy Back cafe in Jindalee, just outside of Brisbane, came up with the idea after seeing a video of the multi-coloured creations on social media page I Brew Coffee.
item.content:encoded:
It's usually the city of Melbourne offering up a quirky and original way of drinking coffee - whether that be with charcoal added or 'de-constructing' the popular drink.

But the top end of Australia is giving them a good run for their money, this time in the way of a rainbow-tinted brew.

Piggy Back cafe in Jindalee, just outside of Brisbane, came up with the idea after seeing a video of the multi-coloured creations on social media page I Brew Coffee.

Scroll down for video 

But the top end of Australia is giving them a good run for their money, this time in the way of a rainbow-tinted brew

Head barista Emily Coumbis told FEMAIL they're very simple to make - it's merely the addition of food dye to the warmed milk after it has been frothed.

'We posted some things on Instagram and people started to take notice,' she said of the sensation.

'More people kept coming in and requesting it so we decided to put it on the menu.'

And that they did. Where a small ordinary coffee costs $3.80 and a large $4.80, customers can experience the joy of 'tasting the rainbow' for $6 a pop.

Head barista Emily Coumbis told FEMAIL they're very simple to make - it's merely the addition of food dye to the warmed milk after it has been frothed

'We get quite a few regular customers who come in every single day for it. But then we also get a lot of tourists as well,' she said

'We get quite a few regular customers who come in every single day for it. But then we also get a lot of tourists as well,' she said.

The cafe has even put up a map of the world inside and encourage customers to 'pin' where they're from - so they can track their global reach.

'At the moment there are quite a few pins in Japan, America and a big cluster in Europe. We had one person from Iceland as well which is pretty cool,' Emily added.

The cafe has even put up a map of the world inside and encourage customers to 'pin' where they're from - so they can track their global reach

And because it's the 'exact same dye they use to make rainbow cake' it's completely safe to ingest again and again

And because it's the 'exact same dye they use to make rainbow cake' it's completely safe to ingest again and again. 

Emily, who is an expert at 'rainbow art', often shares her pictures of butterflies, swans and palm trees on Instagram to encourage other people to come in and try it for themselves.

And never fear, the rainbow art works perfectly with almond milk - so this isn't a treat lactose intolerant or vegan friends and family members will have to miss out on.  

Emily (pictured), who is an expert at 'rainbow art', often shares her pictures of butterflies, swans and palm trees on Instagram to encourage other people to come in and try it for themselves

'We posted some things on Instagram and people started to take notice,' she said of the sensation. 'More people kept coming in and requesting it so we decided to put it on the menu (left and right).

item.title: 'You can't weigh happiness': TV presenter Shelley Horton, 45, poses in swimsuit after she dramatically lost 13kg - as she admits 'I don't feel panicked about the scales'
item.description: When Shelly Horton turned to intermittent fasting diet after trying everything imaginable to lose weight, she dramatically shed 13kg in just 17 weeks.
item.content:encoded:
When Shelly Horton turned to intermittent fasting diet after trying everything imaginable to lose weight, she dramatically shed 13kg in just 17 weeks.

The Australian media personality - who struggled with her weight for most part of her life - had tipped the scales at 92kg.

Earlier this year, the 45-year-old looked stunning when she showed off her slimmer frame after her impressive weight loss.

But as she juggled the demands of her hectic work schedule, the television presenter admitted she recently put some weight back on.

Despite this, Shelly said she feels happier more than ever - as she proudly shared a photograph of herself posing at Muri Beach in the Cook Islands in a swimsuit.

Shelly Horton said she feels happier more than ever - as she proudly shared a photograph of herself posing at Muri Beach in the Cook Islands in a swimsuit

Before and after: Earlier this year, the 45-year-old - who used to tip the scales at 92kg - looked stunning when she showed off her slimmer frame after her impressive weight loss

'Body image is such a tricky thing. To me it comes down to happiness. And I feel really happy at the moment,' she wrote on Instagram. 

'I lost 13kg thanks to and it helped me feel happy that I was in control of my weight rather than it was controlling me. 

'I have put a couple of kilos back on over the past month because I have been working crazy hours.'

Keeping a positive mind frame, Shelly said she hasn't let her weight gain deter her from enjoying life.

'I've been kicking massive career goals and that makes me really happy. So for the first time I don't feel panicked about the scales,' she said.

Setting herself a goal, Shelly said she's determined to undergo SuperFastDiet again - a weight loss program that saw her lose weight successfully.

'I know after Easter I will get back on SFD properly and I'll be on my way to reaching my goal weight. It's a good feeling,' she said.

'So expect a few swimsuit shots because you can't weigh happiness. Hope you're happy too.'

Keeping a positive mind frame, Shelly said she hasn't let her weight gain deter her from enjoying life

Earlier this year, the media personality revealed she had gastric band surgery in a desperate attempt lose weight - but the procedure simply didn't work for her

Her latest Instagram post comes just months after she revealed she had gastric band surgery in a desperate attempt to lose weight - but the procedure simply didn't work for her.

Shelly initially thought that the surgery would be worth it in the end but unfortunately she only lost two kilos in the first month.

Eventually, she turned to SuperFastDiet, which is based on intermittent fasting, where her weight started to fall off.

'I have always struggled to lose weight, and honestly, I've tried everything, but I've never been able to achieve those miracle results like other people,' Shelley said.

'And because of that, I've felt like a big fat failure. And those were the words that I would use in my head: that's how I would talk to myself.

'I'm not even at my goal weight yet, and I've lost 13 kilos in 17 weeks.'
item.dc:abstract: When Shelly Horton turned to intermittent fasting diet after trying everything imaginable to lose weight, she dramatically shed 13kg in just 17 weeks. The Australian media personality - who struggled with her weight for most part of her life - had tipped the scales at 92kg (left). Earlier this year, the 45-year-old looked stunning when she showed off her slimmer frame after her impressive weight loss. But as she juggled the demands of her hectic work schedule, the television presenter admitted she recently put some weight back on. Despite this, Shelly said she feels happier more than ever - as she proudly shared a photograph (right) of herself posing at Muri Beach in the Cook Islands in a swimsuit.

item.title: Easter entertaining made easy! How to create the perfect table setting and show-stopping cake for your family and friends this long weekend
item.description: Stylist, Allira Bell, shared the simple, budget-friendly ways you can style your home on a shoestring this Easter. She revealed it's all about up-cycling and using items from your home and garden.
item.content:encoded:
With the Easter long weekend just around the corner, the house-proud among us will be turning our thoughts towards table settings, centre pieces and decorations.

But if you've got the in-laws coming around for lunch and the whole thing is starting to fill you with a sense of dread, then don't worry.

Stylist, Allira Bell, from online furniture retailer Temple and Webster, has shared the simple, budget-friendly ways you can style your home this Easter.

Speaking to Today Extra, she revealed it's all about up-cycling and using items from your existing home and garden to give that rustic, homely finish.

Scroll down for video 

Stylist, Allira Bell from online retailer, Temple and Webster, has shared the simple, budget-friendly ways you can style your home on a shoestring this Easter (pictured: her table setting)

According to Allira, you start with a runner, which for her is a 'really soft, beautiful muslin' (pictured) - add this to your table

Then, start decorating with various different types of foliage that might be able to be found in your garden (pictured) and add shells for a personal touch

'This looks like a really layered table-scape, but it's actually really easy to create using things that you already have at home or in your garden,' Allira told the program.

'We've started with our runner, which is a really soft, beautiful muslin. And then we've added different types of foliage for depth and colour. Then, I've put in some shells for a personal touch and texture.'

Next, the leading stylist revealed it's all about the additional things that will set your table apart.

Allira favours little nests comprising hard-boiled eggs, wire and raffia:

'All you need is some raffia, eggs, food dye and a little bit of wire,' she explained, adding that your first step is dyeing the eggs a festive colour. 

To do this, she recommends you put your pre-boiled eggs inside some boiled water, add a tablespoon of vinegar, and half a cap of blue and pink food dye:

'You literally just drop the eggs in and leave them there for between two and ten minutes,' she said. 'Until it's a rich colour.'

Finally, to add your bunny ears, wrap gold wire around the circumference of the egg and 'use your fingers to create some bunny ears'.

'The more rough and organic it is, the better it will look,' she concluded. 

For the little table settings, Allira recommends you dye the eggs with food dye (pictured) - all you need for this is raffia, food dye, twine wire and vinegar

She explained that you can re-purpose your Christmas wreath by adding plastic eggs from a craft store with a hot glue gun, feathers and Baby's-breath flowers (pictured)

When it comes to ways you can use old items in your home for another budget-friendly purpose, Allira said a great idea is to turn your Christmas wreath (if it was fake) into something more in tune with Easter:

'We up-cycled a Christmas wreath,' she said.

To do this, all you need to do is glue on plastic eggs from a craft store with a hot glue gun, as well as some little feathers and Baby's-breath flowers.

'I love resting wreaths against things, but you could also hang them on the wall and swap out some art for Easter,' Allira added.

Dyed eggs (pictured) are a great way to get your children involved this Easter holiday weekend

To get the kids involved this holiday weekend, you'll want an arts and craft project that's fun, easy and allows them to engage their creative sides:

'I've traced a bunny shape onto a book page, and then you can cut it out,' Allira said.

Hunt down some material from your local fabric store, glue it onto your bunny shape as a tale and punch two holes in each of the ears, before threading the twine through and hanging it up in your home.

Allira revealed that she wanted to make her cake the centre point or focal centre of her table setting (pictured), you can do this with trailing Baby's-breath

Finally, Allira revealed how to make your Easter cake look like the centre piece of your Easter dining room, by making a few simple additions:

'This is a layered cake and it's going to have a big, beautiful display on top,' she said.

'Just grab a big dollop of this icing and add lots of texture. It looks really professional, but you can see that I'm just being really haphazard with it. 

'Play with different shapes and heights,' she added.

'I'm going to add some feathers and some pre-boiled eggs, making sure to warn people that they're not in fact chocolate.'

Finally, add more Baby's-breath to your decadent creation, and hang some 'trailing off to the side' for an interior-designer-approved look.

'This will be the centre piece and will act as a focal point on the setting,' Allira concluded.
item.dc:abstract: With the Easter long weekend just around the corner, the house-proud among us will be turning our thoughts towards table settings, centre pieces and decorations. With this in mind, stylist, Allira Bell, has shared the simple, budget-friendly ways you can style your home on a shoestring this Easter (main and inset). She said it's all about using items from your home and garden, and up-cycling them to give them an Easter finish.
item.dc:creator: Sophie Haslett
item.mi:shortTitle: Easter entertaining made easy: How to style your table on a budget

item.title: From a coastal trek in Tasmania to 'spoga' classes in a treehouse: The top wellness retreats to reset and recharge this Easter
item.description: More Australians than ever are ditching boozy, indulgent holidays in favour of luxurious wellness retreats in a bid to reset their health and fitness.
item.content:encoded:
More Australians than ever are ditching boozy, indulgent holidays in favour of luxurious wellness retreats in a bid to reset their health and fitness. 

And with Easter edging closer, many are planning to forego their traditional chocolate-laden feasts and jet off to spend their Easter break on an epic wellness adventure.

From discovering a verdant tropical jungle in Bali to trekking the Tasmanian coast, here FEMAIL looks at the most opulent Easter wellness getaways for adventure travel enthusiasts as revealed by Health and Fitness Travel. 

With Easter edging closer, many are planning to forego their traditional chocolate-laden feasts and jet off to spend their Easter break on an epic wellness adventure (pictured is COMO)

WHITE WATER RAFTING IN BALI   

Adventure meets luxury at COMO Shambhala Estate, a holistic haven tucked in the tropical jungles of Bali. 

Guests will journey down the Ayung River in Ubud for a thrilling white-water rafting action - the river providing pleasant rafting conditions all-year round with enough rapids to make the ride exhilarating without becoming too extreme.

Perfect for beginners or those with experience, Ayung generally has gentle rapids with the occasional obstacle. After the adrenaline rush guests can enjoy a spa treatment to fully rejuvenate the mind and body.

Price: Five night packages start from $2,415 per person twin share

Adventure meets luxury at COMO Shambhala Estate, a holistic haven tucked in the tropical jungles of Bali

Guests will journey down the Ayung River in Ubud for a thrilling white-water rafting action

COASTAL TREK IN TASMANIA    

Together with a small group of no more than ten hikers, guests can enjoy a a four-day journey through the most dramatic landscapes along the coast of Mt. William National Park in north-eastern Tasmania. 

On the first night, they will wind down along white sandy beaches at the Forester Beach Camp and by the second and third, they are invited to enjoy the pure remoteness at the Bay of Fires Lodge, set 40 meters above the beach. 

Guests will look out to the most stunning surroundings from glass pavilions or an open living area complete with a fireplace and nooks for complete relaxation.

Price: Three night packages start from $2,380 per person twin share 

Together with a small group of no more than ten hikers, guests can enjoy a a four-day journey through the most dramatic landscapes along the coast of Mt. William National Park 

On the first night, they will wind down along white sandy beaches at the Forester Beach Camp

TRAIN LIKE AN OLYMPIAN IN THAILAND 

The more athletic types can head to Thanyapura which boasts some of the world's top sports and fitness coaches.

Created for triathletes of all ages and abilities, guests can maximise their endurance and reach their health goals through education, sport and wellness on this holiday. 

As well as hosting iron man races for ambitious travellers, the retreat also provides other wellness activities such as swimming, cycling and meditative training to teach strict mental focus. 

Their philosophy stresses the importance of mind-body connection and will ensure you return home with new found strength and inner-balance. 

Price: Seven night packages start from $1,430 per person twin share

The more athletic types can head to Thanyapura which boasts some of the world's top sports and fitness coaches

Created for triathletes of all ages and abilities, guests can maximise their endurance and reach their health goals through education, sport and wellness on this holiday

GO KITE SURFING IN MAURITIUS 

Among heavenly beaches and sparkling turquoise water lies Shanti Maurice; an Indian Ocean jewel with an extensive leisure program dedicated to fitness and wellness. 

Guests can enjoy a variety of workout offerings, from endurance-boosting beach runs and intense aqua spinning to mindful meditations. 

They can also enjoy the new kite surfing area at the renowned water sports hotspot, Le Morne. 

At the end of the day guests can unwind with an Ayurvedic massage at the luxurious NIRA spa.

Price: Seven night packages start from $2,840 per person twin share

Among heavenly beaches and sparkling turquoise water lies Shanti Maurice; an Indian Ocean jewel with an extensive leisure program dedicated to fitness and wellness

They can also enjoy the new kite surfing area at the renowned water sports hotspot, Le Morne 

At the end of the day guests can unwind with an Ayurvedic massage at the luxurious NIRA spa 

DO YOGA IN THE HIMALAYAN MOUNTAINS

Travellers can discover the true meaning of contentment while admiring the majestic Himalayan mountain range, just on the doorstep of Ananda resort.

Guests will explore the benefits of a gentle yet powerful practice of yoga and build a strong, determined mind and long lean muscles. 

To intensify the spiritual, calming experience, those who attend Ananda can make use of their adventurous walks and treks in the mountains to sharpen their focus and reset their mind.  

Price: Seven night packages start from $4,700 per person twin share 

Travellers can discover the true meaning of contentment while admiring the majestic Himalayan mountain range, just on the doorstep of Ananda resort

Guests will explore the benefits of a gentle yet powerful practice of yoga and build a strong, determined mind and long lean muscles

CLEANSE YOUR BODY IN THAILAND   

Australians can give their bodies a break from the Easter binge this year and instead do the complete opposite: a cleanse. 

With an array of fitness and sports activities, such as interval training and different variations of yoga, Phuket Cleanse is ideal for any type of fitness aficionado 

After nourishing their soul at yoga, guests can nourish their stomach with Phuket Cleanse's wholesome, scrumptious creations that will leave them feeling satisfied and refuelled. 

They can also combine their cleansing break with detox juices and inspiring educational cooking classes that will provide long-term benefits.

Price: Seven night packages start from $2,520 per person twin share

Australians can give their bodies a break from the Easter binge this year and instead do the complete opposite: a cleanse

After nourishing their soul at yoga, guests can nourish their stomach with Phuket Cleanse's wholesome, scrumptious creations that will leave them feeling satisfied and refuelled

DO TREETOP 'SPOGA' IN ST LUCIA   

BodyHoliday is an outstanding destination for those looking to combine physical and spiritual practices whilst indulging in soul-soaring views.

Here, guests can experience the hottest new workout trend with 'spoga' - a hybrid fitness class combining dynamic spinning with calming yoga in a luxurious glass treehouse. 

This workout is designed to completely change guests' outlook on high-intensity workouts as the soothing yoga repairs the body afterwards.

After having worked their bodies, guests can enjoy a spa treatment overlooking the beach to make the most out of their healthy holiday.

Price: Seven night packages start from $2,910 per person twin share 

Here, guests can experience the hottest new workout trend with 'spoga' - a hybrid fitness class combining dynamic spinning with calming yoga in a luxurious glass treehouse

BodyHoliday is an outstanding destination for those looking to combine physical and spiritual practices whilst indulging in soul-soaring views

GO BIKING AND BOXING IN SARDINIA   

Set on the sunny Italian island of Sardinia, famed for its magnificent beaches, Forte Village is the activity holiday filled with unique experiences. 

Guests can reach their ideal weight with intensive boxing, before finding inner-peace with relaxation techniques. 

Later, they can enjoy mountain bike tours over the glorious mountains behind Santa Margherita di Pula and outdoor cardio sessions will allow them to explore the region's fascinating spots while burning calories and boosting endurance.

Price: Seven night packages start from $4,130 per person twin share 

Set on the sunny Italian island of Sardinia, famed for its magnificent beaches, Forte Village is the activity holiday filled with unique experiences

Guests can reach their ideal weight with intensive boxing or cycling, before finding inner-peace with relaxation techniques

ENJOY A HIGH-ENERGY ADVENTURE IN COSTA RICA 

Considered one of the world's most bio-diverse countries, this outstanding South American region boasts abundant flora and fauna just waiting to be explored. 

Guests are invited to dance in the rainforests during a catamaran tour including interaction with howler monkeys and tasting of traditional food and beverages or go white-water rafting on the Chirripo River.

The latter high-energy activity features stunning sites like the Irazu volcano and Braulio National Park. 

After receiving an authentic insight of this exotic country, guests canreset for the next day at Costa Rica Discover Recover.

Price: 10 night packages start from $4,705 per person twin share 

Considered one of the world's most bio-diverse countries, this outstanding South American region boasts abundant flora and fauna just waiting to be explored

Guests are invited to dance in the rainforests during a catamaran tour or go white-water rafting on the Chirripo River

CATCH A WAVE IN MOROCCO   

Located on the stunning coastline of South Morocco, Paradis Plage combines thrilling surf class and beachfront yoga with Arabic design and contemporary facilities. 

This healthy getaway is a mecca for all surf-enthusiasts, regardless if they are beginners or professionals. 

Guests can grab a surfboard and catch the waves within minutes of waking up and clear their heads and unwind as the calming waves bring them inner peace.

Price: Seven night packages start from $1,345 per person twin share  

Located on the stunning coastline of South Morocco, Paradis Plage combines thrilling surf class and beachfront yoga with Arabic design and contemporary facilities

This healthy getaway is a mecca for all surf-enthusiasts, regardless if they are beginners or professionals

item.title: Think you know everything about EASTER EGGS? See if you can get the perfect score in the Mail's quiz
item.description: Think you know everything there is to know about Easter eggs? Are you a religious traditions expert? See if you can get the perfect score in the MailOnline's Easter egg quiz.
item.content:encoded:
Questions

1) According to the Church of England, which two of these do Easter eggs represent?

A. Generosity

B. New life

C. The meal Jesus ate at the Last Supper

D. The stone at the entrance to Jesus’s tomb

2) According to polling firm YouGov, people who like Easter eggs are most likely to be:

A. Old, male and Left-wing

B. Young, male and Right-wing

C. Young, female and Right-wing

D. Old, female and Left-wing

When did the UK’s first chocolate eggs go on sale?

3) True or false? If you stacked all Cadbury Creme Eggs made in a year on top of each other, they would be as tall as Everest.

4) When did the UK’s first chocolate eggs go on sale?

A. 1601

B. 1732

C. 1873

D. 1946

5) The average amount of chocolate gifted to children at Easter is equal to how many times their recommended sugar intake?

A. Three times

B. Six times

C. 11 times

D. 21 times

6) True or false? The world’s most expensive (non-jewelled) chocolate egg sold for £7,000.

ANSWERS

1) B, new life. And D, the stone at the entrance to Jesus’s tomb

Christians believe that just as a chick has to break an eggshell to emerge, Jesus had to break out of the tomb in his resurrection and new life. The eggs can be seen to symbolise rolling away the stone.

Even before Christianity, in China and Ancient Greece and Rome gifts of eggs were given in spring to celebrate new life.

2) B, young, male and Right-wing

The pollsters also found that Easter egg fans are likely to enjoy doing puzzles, watching The Great British Bake Off and listening to the music of Taylor Swift.

3) False

More than 500 million Creme Eggs are produced every year and they would form a pile ten times higher than Mount Everest.

4) C, 1873

They were made by Fry’s of Bristol. The first Cadbury Easter egg emerged in 1875 and Rowntree’s first was made in 1904.

5) D, 21 times

The average UK child’s Easter chocolate hoard contains 1,000g of fat and 2,000g of sugar, according to a survey carried out by Wren Kitchens.

If they devour it all between Good Friday and Easter Monday, a seven to ten-year-old would be consuming 21 times their recommended sugar intake for the four-day period.

6) True

The record was cracked in 2012, when a 50kg handmade chocolate egg, which took seven people more than three days to make, sold in London. Its filling contained Japanese black vinegar, rosemary and olive oil and edible gold leaf.
